text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Transfer of naval
			 vessels to certain foreign recipients

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to transfer vessels to foreign
			 countries on a grant basis under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of
			 1961

text.#text:
To
			 the Government of Mexico, the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates
			 USS CURTS (FFG–38) and USS MCCLUSKY (FFG–41).

To the Government of Thailand, the OLIVER
			 HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS RENTZ (FFG–46) and USS
			 VANDEGRIFT (FFG–48).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to transfer the OLIVER HAZARD
			 PERRY class guided missile frigates USS TAYLOR (FFG–50), USS GARY (FFG–51), USS
			 CARR (FFG–52), and USS ELROD (FFG–55) to the Taipei Economic and Cultural
			 Representative Office of the United States (which is the Taiwan instrumentality
			 designated pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 10(a) of the Taiwan Relations Act
section 21 of the Arms Export Control Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to transfer specific vessels to specific countries, the

is authorized, subject to the same conditions that would apply for
			 such country under this Act, to transfer any vessel named in this Act to any
			 country named in this Act such that the total number of vessels transferred to
			 such country does not exceed the total number of vessels authorized for
			 transfer to such country by this Act.

shall not
			 be counted against the aggregate value of excess defense articles transferred
			 in any fiscal year under

text.#text:
The value of a vessel transferred to another country on
			 a grant basis pursuant to authority provided by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

header.#text:
Grants not
			 counted in annual total of transferred excess defense
			 articles

text.#text:
Any expense incurred by the United States in connection
			 with a transfer authorized by this section shall be charged to the recipient
			 notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516(e) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require, as a condition of the transfer of a
			 vessel under this section, that the recipient to which the vessel is
			 transferred have such repair or refurbishment of the vessel as is needed,
			 before the vessel joins the naval forces of that recipient, performed at a
			 shipyard located in the United States, including a United States Navy
			 shipyard.

text.#text:
To the maximum extent
			 practicable, the

header.#text:
Repair and
			 refurbishment in united states shipyards

text.#text:
The authority to transfer a vessel under this section
			 shall expire at the end of the 3-year period beginning on the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the transfer of naval
		  vessels to certain foreign recipients.
